DOC.brief_summary: To determine efficacy of preoperative IV dexamethasone for postoperative pain control after TKA.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Preoperative Intravenous Dexamethasone in Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.detailed_description: Preoperative intravenous over 0.1 mg/kg of dexamethasone could be reduced pain after primary TKA.
DOC.criteria: Osteoarthritis of the knee who undergoing unilateral primary total knee arthroplasty 5085 years old ASA class 13 Unable to perform spinal anaesthesia History of drug allergies: steroids Renal impairment (CrCl <30 mL/min) Liver impairment Cognitive function disorders Poor controlled DM (HA1C > 7.5) Morning DTX at operative day > 180 mg% Received corticosteroids within 3 months before surgery
